meanings.definition: The changing of the substance of bread and wine into the body and blood of Christ during the Eucharist.
meanings.sent1: During the Eucharist, the transubstantiation of bread and wine occurs.
meanings.sent2: Catholics believe in transubstantiation during the Eucharist.
meanings.sent3: At the Eucharist, the magical transubstantiation of bread and wine takes place.
meanings.sent4: The transubstantiation of bread and wine into the body and blood of Christ is a profound mystery.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the transubstantiation during the Eucharist is a spiritual experience.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that the bread and wine actually change into the body and blood of Christ during the Eucharist.
meanings.sent1: The doctrine of transubstantiation teaches that bread and wine transform into Christ's body and blood.
meanings.sent2: Believers follow the doctrine of transubstantiation during the Eucharist.
meanings.sent3: According to the doctrine of transubstantiation, bread and wine undergo a miraculous change.
meanings.sent4: The doctrine of transubstantiation is a cornerstone of Catholic belief.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the doctrine of transubstantiation requires faith and reflection.
